description: The paper introduces Logit-scaling GFlowNets (Logit-GFN), a new architectural design aimed at improving the training efficiency and stability of temperature-conditional GFlowNets. The method reduces the numerical challenges arising from different gradient profiles at various temperatures by using a learned function of temperature to scale the logits of the policy directly. Empirical results show enhanced generalization and mode discovery in various biological and chemical tasks using this approach.

title.value: Learning to Scale Logits for Temperature-Conditional GFlowNets

sub_research_field.justification: The focus is on generative flow networks (GFlowNets), which are a type of deep generative model.
sub_research_field.quote: Generative flow networks (GFlowNets) constitute a class of deep generative models and a reinforcement learning (RL) methodology designed to sample compositional objects.
